tweets.text: and then I find myself in this position where someone has convinced their org all of the amazing things that collecting data will do for them, and they collect it, and they come to me to figure out what's inside, "what insights are in there" they ask- idk, the ones you put in it
"Collecting more data got them those insights, right?" well, sort of it, it's more like they knew what they wanted and then measured the things that would help them know that

in data, it often happens that someone with the data equivalent of a disposable point-and-shoot camera assumes that, because they are using the right technology, they should get all the insights of their neighbor with HD cameras rigged up at every conceivable angle
dammit i put all that effort into finally learning how to use vim and vscode is cool as heck, huh

No, I'm sorry, I have some clay, but I'm kneading cute little things out of it. I wanna make sculptures. More clay. More data. Big data.
I feel like a sculptor with no clay. Except my raw material is the flotsam of analytical indulgences of start-ups and journos. Kinda rare.
I'm going to take all of your data and then I'm going to find little funny things in it and then I'm going to turn it into little circles.
Somebody give me tons of data. Metric tons of data. I'm talking garbage trucks full of data. All sorts. I want all the data. Uh... big data.

Cleaning. Not really enjoying it.

Loving the sunburn on my shoulders.
